## Ready to unplug and reconnect?

Our Camping Weekend is ECRS's most affordable residential event – where newcomers and longtime members gather under the stars for a weekend of pure play. Dive into daytime classes that spark your curiosity, then join the whole community Friday and Saturday nights for folk dancing, singing, games, and good conversation over snacks. All ages, all welcome.

Bring a friend to the bonfire and make a dozen more!

## About Camp Onas

Camp Onas is located in Ottsville, PA and features rustic camping accommodations perfect for a weekend of outdoor fun and community connection.

## More Details Coming Soon

Full registration, pricing, and class descriptions will be available in May 2026. For updates, contact registration@ecrs.org.

## A whole day — packed with play!

We'll start with an **opening program** to warm people up with ice breakers, dancing, and games. Then dive into **workshops**, share a **potluck feast**, and come together for our **signature evening program** with more games, dancing, and singing.

Whether leading a workshop or showing up ready to play, you'll build community and skills while having an absolute blast. All ages, all energy levels – just bring yourself!

## Join us for a weekend of ECRS fun and community at a new location!

Newcomers and ECRS veterans alike will love a weekend of pure play at Pendle Hill. Dive into daytime classes that spark your curiosity – dancing, singing, informal dramatics, crafts, or games. Then Friday and Saturday nights, the whole community comes together for folk dancing, singing, games, and good conversation over snacks. All ages, all welcome.

## About Pendle Hill

Pendle Hill is a historic Quaker retreat center (since 1930) nestled on 24 wooded acres in Wallingford, PA – just outside Philly. Between activities, explore the grounds, browse the bookstore, or cozy up in the library.

**Accommodations** feature twin beds in private or shared rooms with hall baths. Expect delicious family-style meals with organic garden produce (vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free available). Easy access via Regional Rail or a 20-minute drive from PHL airport.

Learn more: https://pendlehill.org

## Options for Local Participants

Folks who live near Pendle Hill are welcome to join us for the weekend without sleeping over (all programs plus all six meals for a reduced rate), provided you register in advance.

## Children Welcome!

Children aged twelve or older can attend workshops on their own! If under age 12, they must be accompanied by an adult at all times.

A creative and joyous alternative holiday experience with diverse classes, evening community gatherings, buffet-style meals, and the chance to celebrate New Year's Eve in a uniquely ECRS way.

Located on 600 acres near Corning, NY, The Y at Watson Woods conference center offers ideal positioning for winter activities and local attractions including the Corning Museum of Glass. The facility is wheelchair accessible.

ECRS Winter Adventure offers a creative and joyous alternative holiday experience with diverse classes engaging participants of all ages across four days. Sample from a smorgasbord of 2- and 4-day classes spanning dance, games, sketching, theater, crafts, mindfulness, and more.

Evening gatherings feature mixed-age activities including games, dancing, informal dramatics, sing-alongs, and conversation. Late-night activities follow evening snacks. Celebrate New Year's Eve in a uniquely ECRS way!
All meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) are buffet-style at large round tables, promoting connection among participants. Vegetarian and gluten-free options are available upon registration.

Between classes, enjoy board games, puzzles, fireplace relaxation, naps, walks, or local exploration. Winter activities like sledding and hiking are available, plus easy access to the Corning Museum of Glass.

Participants should mask in crowded indoor spaces during the week prior to the event and monitor their health. Attendees who are ill are requested not to attend to protect the health of our community.
Before December 1: Room & board is refunded; tuition is non-refundable. After December 1: No refunds, except for communicable illness (50% refund of total registration).
Ages 0-5 receive free room and board. Ages 6-12 are classified as 'Child' for pricing. Ages 13+ are classified as 'Adult' for pricing.

Building community through creative recreation since 1940

The Eastern Cooperative Recreation School is a nonprofit organization established in 1940. For over seventy-five years, ECRS has offered recreation leadership training based on the belief that recreation is an important tool for teachers, social workers, and anyone else who works with people.

We believe that play is fundamental to human experience, offering benefits like community building and personal growth. ECRS provides creative and engaging activities for all ages that are fun, build community and develop leadership.

At ECRS, we believe that recreation is more than just entertainment—it's a pathway to enriched living. Our programs emphasize enjoyment, creativity, cooperation, and personal growth. We create spaces where people of all ages can connect, learn, and play together in a warm and welcoming environment.
Cooperative, multi-generational games that bring people together

Weaving, puppetry, nature crafts, and more
Learn about our founding in 1940 and our evolution over the decades
Discover the six core principles that guide everything we do

We'd love to hear from you

Do you have questions about ECRS? Want to learn more about our events or how to get involved? Feel free to submit your question using the form below, or contact one of our regional representatives listed below.

Your generous donations help ECRS maintain affordable event costs and provide family discounts and event scholarships, including to those in the field of recreation.

Every contribution, no matter the size, helps us continue our mission of building community through creative recreation.

ECRS is a tax-exempt organization under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Your contribution is therefore fully tax-deductible since no goods or services have been exchanged.

You will receive a confirmation email that can be used to claim your tax-deducted donation.
Over 80 years of building community through play

ECRS is a nonprofit organization founded in 1940 to provide cooperative recreation as a way to rest and refresh, to add richness and depth to living, and to aid the development of communities and humanity at large.

For over seventy-five years, ECRS has operated based on the belief that recreation is a pathway to enriched living, serving educators, social workers, and anyone who works with people.

Our name tells our story:

**Eastern** – We're based in the Eastern United States, with members and events primarily in the Northeast region.

**Cooperative** – We operate collaboratively, with members sharing responsibilities for planning and running events. Everyone contributes, and everyone benefits.

**Recreation** – We believe play is essential for mental health and well-being. Recreation isn't frivolous—it's fundamental to a balanced life.

**School** – Learning is at the heart of what we do. We teach recreation leadership skills that participants can bring back to their own communities.

ECRS was founded with a mission to develop recreation leaders who could bring the joy of cooperative play to their communities. The Leadership Development Committee played a key role in evaluating competencies and helping members grow as facilitators and teachers.

From the beginning, ECRS emphasized learning by doing. Participants didn't just attend classes—they learned to lead them. This apprenticeship model remains central to our approach today.

Over the decades, ECRS has expanded its programming to include new forms of creative expression. While we've maintained our traditional core activities—folk dancing, singing, games, and dramatics—we've also embraced new offerings.

Today's ECRS events might include self-exploration classes, role-playing games, drumming circles, puppetry workshops, and mindfulness practices. We continue to evolve while staying true to our founding principles of cooperation, creativity, and community.
Welcome to ECRS – Come to Play. Play to Learn
ECRS is an intergenerational organization providing creative and engaging activities that are fun, develop leadership and build community.

## About

*Want to play like a kid? Dance the cha-cha or a folk favorite? Foster close human relationships? Develop leadership skills? We offer fun activities – both active and relaxing – that emphasize enjoyment, creativity, cooperation and personal growth.*

ECRS is a warm and welcoming community for folks of all ages. Join us at an event and explore an ever-changing menu of optional daily classes – from drama and dance to crafts and creating personal change – led by our skilled and caring leaders (who are also members!). Meals are family-style and there's plenty of planned downtime for relaxing, connecting, or sharing your own recreational activity. In the evening (and sometimes into the wee hours) we make our own merriment when we gather for the evening program, a smorgasbord of folk dancing, singing, informal dramatics and cooperative games.

An ECRS event is an experience not to be missed! We have been building community with fun-filled, intergenerational events for more than 75 years. Come experience for yourself at a one-day, weekend (including a camping weekend in early June), or our signature five-day-long Winter Adventure.

- Singing
- Dancing
- Informal dramatics
- Cooperative games
- Crafts
- Personal development
Join our community of play and creativity

At ECRS, members gather together to engage in music, crafts, drama, dance, and games. But it's not just about the activities—it's about how we approach them. Here are the principles that guide everything we do.

We believe enjoyment doesn't require costly packaged entertainment. Instead, groups create their own games, songs, skits, crafts, and dances—generating enjoyment, laughter, and creativity that comes from within.
We prioritize activities simply because they enrich our lives, not for competition or performance outcomes. The joy is in the doing, not in winning or impressing others.
We focus on personal development and experience quality, asking "How was that for you?" rather than judging final results. Growth happens in the journey, not just the destination.
We provide genuine, quality human interaction to counteract the isolation that technology can create in modern society. Real connections happen when people play together.
We explore working, playing, and creating together for the common good while respecting all individuals, regardless of age, race, sexual preference, competence, or social status.
We promote valuing meaningful moments over material possessions. The memories and relationships formed at ECRS events last far longer than any purchase.
Help us continue creating joyous, creative events for our community
